#336546

Machine Learning in Healthcare

Syllabus    Notations

Instructor

Joachim Behar

Teaching Assistants

Moran Davoodi
Yuval Ben Sason
Kevin Kotzen

Summary

In this course you will learn about aspects of information processing including data preprocessing, visualization, regression, dimensionality reduction (PCA, ICA), feature selection, classification (LR, SVM, NN) and their usage for decision support in the context of healthcare. The course aims to provide an overview of computer tools and machine learning techniques for dealing with medical datasets (time series and images). The course is practical with computer based tutorials and assignments. The necessary theory will be covered.

Logistics

  • Course Title  Machine Learning in Healthcare
  • Short title  ML in Healthcare
  • Course ref. no.  336546
  • Number of credits  3
  • Course assessment  Coursework + 3 assignments

Teaching Objectives

Students will acquire the following skills

  • Python for biomedical data science
  • Main classifiers, intuition and mathematical background
  • Neural networks and deep learning
  • Performance statistics in healthcare
  • ML for diagnosis, prognosis and treatment

Course Material

  • Syllabus

Lectures
  • BME-336546-L01-Introduction to machine learning in healthcare
  • BME-336546-L02-Data exploration and preprocessing
  • BME-336546-L03-Linear models for regression
  • BME-336546-L04-Linear models for classification
  • BME-336546-L05-Odds and odds ratio
  • BME-336546-L06-Regularization
  • BME-336546-L07-Practical consideration on training a model
  • BME-336546-L08-Performance statistics
  • BME-336546-L09-Introduction to nonlinear models
  • BME-336546-L10-Support vector machines
  • BME-336546-L11-Feature selection
  • BME-336546-L12-Unsupervised learning with k-means and Gaussian mixture models
  • BME-336546-L13-Principal component analysis
  • BME-336546-L14-Independant component analysis
  • BME-336546-L15-Neural Networks I
  • BME-336546-L16-Neural Networks II
  • BME-336546-L17-Neural Networks III
  • BME-336546-L18-Introduction to convolutional neural networks
  • BME-336546-GL01-Performance computing (Guest lecture Dr. Anne Weill)

Code base tutorials
  • BME-336546-C00-Introduction to Git
  • BME-336546-C01-Python, numpy and friends
  • BME-336546-C02-Data exploration and preprocessing
  • BME-336546-C03-Linear regression
  • BME-336546-C04-Linear classification (LR)
  • BME-336546-C05-Training a classifier
  • BME-336546-C06-Nonlinear classifier (SVM, RF)
  • BME-336546-C07-Unsupervised learning (k-means, GMM)
  • BME-336546-C08-Unsupervised learning (PCA)
  • BME-336546-C09-Introduction to feedforward neural networks (NN)
  • BME-336546-C10-Feature engineering versus representation learning
  • BME-336546-C11-Hyperparameters optimization in neural networks

Theoretical tutorials
  • BME-336546-T01 Supervised learning
  • BME-336546-T01 Unsupervised learning

The course material can also be found at our public Github repository
